' '[1758-someone] [Someone]1758-someone calls [him]270-man a soul concealed in an animal , ' [I]1758-someone suggested . '[1758-someone] [Winwood Reade]121-winwood reade is good upon the subject , ' said [Holmes]108-holmes . '[121-winwood reade] [He]121-winwood reade remarks that , while [the individual man]914-the individual man is an insoluble puzzle , in the aggregate [he]914-the individual man becomes a mathematical certainty . [You]911-you can , for example , never foretell what [any one man]915-any one man will do , but [you]911-you can say with precision what an average number will be up to . [Individuals]916-individuals vary , but percentages remain constant . So says [the statistician]917-the statistician . But do [I]0-i see a handkerchief ? Surely there is a white flutter over yonder . ' '[917-the statistician] Yes , it is [[your]0-i boy]918-your boy , ' [I]918-your boy cried . '[918-your boy] [I]0-i can see [him]918-your boy plainly . ' '[918-your boy] And there is [the Aurora]728-the aurora , ' exclaimed [Holmes]108-holmes , '[728-the aurora] and going like the devil ! Full speed ahead , [engineer]920-engineer . Make after that launch with the yellow light . By heaven , [I]0-i shall never forgive [myself]0-i if [she]728-the aurora proves to have the heels of [us]921-we ! ' [She]728-the aurora had slipped unseen through [the yard]886-the yard - entrance and passed behind [two or three small craft]1826-two or three small craft , so that [she]728-the aurora had fairly got [her]728-the aurora speed up before [we]921-we saw [her]728-the aurora . Now [she]728-the aurora was flying down [the stream]731-the stream , near in to [the shore]1823-the shore , going at a tremendous rate . [Jones]112-jones looked gravely at [her]728-the aurora and shook [his]112-jones head . '[728-the aurora] [She]728-the aurora is very fast , ' [he]112-jones said . '[728-the aurora] [I]0-i doubt if [we]921-we shall catch [her]728-the aurora . ' '[0-i] [We]921-we must catch [her]728-the aurora ! ' cried [Holmes]108-holmes , between [his]108-holmes teeth . '[0-i] Heap it on , [stokers]922-stokers ! Make [her]728-the aurora do all [she]728-the aurora can ! If [we]921-we burn [the boat]1668-the boat [we]921-we must have [them]1668-the boat ! ' [We]921-we were fairly after [her]728-the aurora now . The furnaces roared , and the powerful engines whizzed and clanked , like a great metallic heart . [Her]728-the aurora sharp , steep prow cut through the still river - water and sent two rolling waves to right and to left of [us]921-we . With every throb of the engines [we]921-we sprang and quivered like a living thing . One great yellow lantern in [our]921-we bows threw a long , flickering funnel of light in front of [us]921-we . Right ahead a dark blur upon the water showed where [the Aurora]50-the aurora lay , and the swirl of white foam behind [her]728-the aurora spoke of the pace at which [she]728-the aurora was going . [We]921-we flashed past [barges]1829-barges , [steamers]1830-steamers , [merchant - vessels]1831-merchant - vessels , in and out , behind [this one]1832-this one and round the other . [Voices]175-voices hailed [us]921-we out of the darkness , but still [the Aurora]50-the aurora thundered on , and still [we]921-we followed close upon [her]50-the aurora track . '[1412-men] Pile it on , [men]1412-men , pile it on ! '[1412-men] Get every pound of steam [you]925-you can . ' '[1412-men] [I]0-i think [we]926-i gain a little , ' said [Jones]112-jones , with [his]112-jones eyes on [the Aurora]50-the aurora . '[0-i] [I]0-i am sure of it , ' said [I.]0-i '[0-i] [We]926-i shall be up with [her]927-her in a very few minutes . ' At that moment , however , as [our]921-we evil fate would have it , [a tug]1834-a tug with [three barges in tow]1835-three barges in tow blundered in between [us]921-we . [She]50-the aurora was still , however , well in view , and the murky , uncertain twilight was settling into a clear , starlit night . [Our]921-we boilers were strained to their utmost , and the frail shell vibrated and creaked with the fierce energy which was driving [us]921-we along . [We]921-we had shot through the pool , past [the West India Docks]1836-the west india docks , down the long [Deptford Reach]75-deptford reach , and up again after rounding [the Isle of Dogs]1837-the isle of dogs . The dull blur in front of [us]921-we resolved itself now clearly enough into [the dainty Aurora]50-the aurora . [Jones]112-jones turned [our]921-we search light upon [her]50-the aurora , so that [we]921-we could plainly see the figures upon [[her]50-the aurora deck]1838-her deck . [One man]1839-one man sat by the stern , with something black between [his]1839-one man knees , over which [he]1839-one man stooped . [The boy]1840-the boy held the tiller , while against the red glare of the furnace [I]926-i could see [old Smith]164-mordecai smith , stripped to the waist , and shovelling coals for dear life . [They]1841-them may have had some doubt at first as to whether [we]921-we were really pursuing [them]1841-them , but now as [we]921-we followed every winding and turning which [they]1841-them took there could no longer be any question about it . At [Greenwich]51-greenwich [we]921-we were about three hundred paces behind [them]1841-them . At [Blackwall]77-blackwall [we]921-we could not have been more than two hundred and fifty . [I]926-i have coursed many creatures in [many countries]1842-many countries during [my]926-i chequered career , but never did sport give [me]926-i such a wild thrill as this mad , flying manhunt down [the Thames]18-the thames . Steadily [we]921-we drew in upon [them]1841-them , [yard]1819-yard by [yard]1819-yard . In the silence of the night [we]921-we could hear the panting and clanking of [their]1841-them machinery . [The man in the stern]1845-the man in the stern still crouched upon [the deck]1846-the deck , and [his]1845-the man in the stern arms were moving as though [he]1845-the man in the stern were busy , while every now and then [he]1845-the man in the stern would look up and measure with a glance the distance which still separated [us]921-we . Nearer [we]921-we came and nearer . [Jones]112-jones yelled to [them]1841-them to stop . [We]921-we were not more than four boat's - lengths behind [them]1841-them , [both boats]1847-both boats flying at a tremendous pace . [He]1845-the man in the stern was [a good - sized , powerful man]1853-a good - sized , powerful man , and as [he]1845-the man in the stern stood poising [himself]1845-the man in the stern with legs astride , [I]926-i could see that from the thigh downwards there was but a wooden stump upon the right side . [The fugitive]1873-the fugitive sprang out , but [his]1873-the fugitive stump instantly sank its whole length into the sodden soil . In vain [he]1873-the fugitive struggled and writhed . Not one step could [he]1873-the fugitive possibly take either forwards or backwards . There was no key , but it was of considerable weight , so [we]1859-we transferred it carefully to [[our]1859-we own little cabin]1879-our own little cabin . '[928-i] See here , ' said [Holmes]108-holmes , pointing to the wooden hatchway . '[928-i] [We]929-me were hardly quick enough with [our]929-me pistols . ' There , sure enough , just behind where [we]1859-we had been standing , stuck one of those murderous darts which [we]1859-we knew so well . It must have whizzed between [us]1859-we at the instant [we]1859-we fired . [Holmes]108-holmes smiled at it and shrugged [his]108-holmes shoulders in [his]108-holmes easy fashion , but [I]929-me confess that it turned [me]929-me sick to think of the horrible death which had passed so close to [us]1859-we that night . [[Our]1859-we captive]1884-our captive sat in [the cabin]1885-the cabin opposite to the iron box which [he]1884-our captive had done so much and waited so long to gain . [He]1884-our captive was [a sunburned , reckless - eyed fellow]1886-a sunburned , reckless - eyed fellow , with a network of lines and wrinkles all over [his]1884-our captive mahogany features , which told of a hard , open - air life . [His]1884-our captive age may have been fifty or thereabouts , for [his]1884-our captive black , curly hair was thickly shot with gray . [His]1884-our captive face in repose was not an unpleasing one , though [his]1884-our captive heavy brows and aggressive chin gave [him]1884-our captive , as [I]929-me had lately seen , a terrible expression when moved to anger . [She]118-mrs. cecil forrester was seated by the open window , dressed in some sort of white diaphanous material , with a little touch of scarlet at the neck and waist . The soft light of a shaded lamp fell upon [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester as [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester leaned back in the basket chair , playing over [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester sweet grave face , and tinting with a dull , metallic sparkle the rich coils of [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester luxuriant hair . At the sound of [my]0-i footfall [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester sprang to [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester feet , however , and a bright flush of surprise and of pleasure coloured [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester pale cheeks . '[0-i] [I]0-i heard [a cab]547-a cab drive up , ' [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester said . '[0-i] [I]0-i thought that [Mrs. Forrester]118-mrs. cecil forrester had come back very early , but [I]0-i never dreamed that it might be [you]0-i . What news have [you]0-i brought [me]0-i ? ' '[0-i] [I]0-i have brought something better than news , ' said [I]0-i , putting down the box upon the table and speaking jovially and boisterously , though [my]0-i heart was heavy within [me]0-i . '[0-i] [I]0-i have brought [you]0-i something which is worth all the news in [the world]205-the world . [I]0-i have brought [you]0-i a fortune . ' [She]118-mrs. cecil forrester glanced at the iron box . '[0-i] Is that the treasure then ? ' [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester asked , coolly enough . '[0-i] Yes , this is the great Agra treasure . Half of it is [yours]0-i and half is [Thaddeus Sholto]120-thaddeus sholto 's . [You]0-i will have a couple of hundred thousand each . Think of that ! An annuity of ten thousand pounds . There will be [few richer young ladies in [England]6-england]971-few richer young ladies in england . Is it not glorious ? ' [I]0-i think that [I]0-i must have been rather overacting [my]0-i delight , and that [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester detected a hollow ring in [my]0-i congratulations , for [I]0-i saw [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester eyebrows rise a little , and [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester glanced at [me]0-i curiously . '[0-i] If [I]0-i have it , ' said [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester , '[0-i] [I]0-i owe it to [you]0-i . ' '[0-i] No , no , ' [I]0-i answered , '[0-i] not to [me]0-i , but to [[my]0-i friend]1776-my friend [Sherlock Holmes]108-holmes . With all the will in [the world]205-the world , [I]0-i could never have followed up a clue which has taxed even [his]108-holmes analytical genius . As it was , [we]974-our very nearly lost it at the last moment . ' '[0-i] Pray sit down and tell [me]0-i all about it , [Dr. Watson]109-watson , ' said [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester . [I]109-watson narrated briefly what had occurred since [I]109-watson had seen [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester last . [Holmes]108-holmes 's new method of search , the discovery of [the Aurora]50-the aurora , the appearance of [Athelney Jones]112-jones , [our]974-our expedition in the evening , and the wild chase down [the Thames]18-the thames . [She]118-mrs. cecil forrester listened with parted lips and shining eyes to [my]109-watson recital of [our]974-our adventures . When [I]109-watson spoke of the dart which had so narrowly missed [us]974-our , [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester turned so white that [I]109-watson feared that [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester was about to faint . '[109-watson] It is nothing , ' [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester said , as [I]0-i hastened to pour [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester out some water . '[0-i] [I]0-i am all right again . It was a shock to [me]0-i to hear that [I]0-i had placed [[my]0-i friends]331-my friends in such horrible peril . ' '[0-i] That is all over , ' [I]0-i answered . '[0-i] It was nothing . [I]0-i will tell [you]0-i no more gloomy details . Let [us]976-us turn to something brighter . There is the treasure . What could be brighter than that ? [I]0-i got leave to bring it with [me]0-i , thinking that it would interest [you]0-i to be the first to see it . ' '[0-i] It would be of the greatest interest to [me]0-i , ' [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester said . There was no eagerness in [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester voice , however . It had struck [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester , doubtless , that it might seem ungracious upon [her]118-mrs. cecil forrester part to be indifferent to a prize which had cost so much to win . '[0-i] What a pretty box ! ' [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester said , stooping over it . '[0-i] This is Indian work , [I]0-i suppose ? ' '[0-i] Yes ; it is Benares metal - work . ' '[0-i] And so heavy ! ' [she]118-mrs. cecil forrester exclaimed , trying to raise it . '[0-i] The box alone must be of some value . Where is the key ? ' '[0-i] Small threw it into the Thames , ' [I]0-i answered . '[0-i] [I]0-i must borrow [Mrs. Forrester]118-mrs. cecil forrester 's poker . ' There was in the front a thick and broad hasp , wrought in the image of [a sitting Buddha]1903-a sitting buddha . Under this [I]118-mrs. cecil forrester thrust the end of the poker and twisted it outward as a lever . The hasp sprang open with a loud snap . With trembling fingers [I]118-mrs. cecil forrester flung back the lid . [We]976-us both stood gazing in astonishment . The box was empty ! No wonder that it was heavy . The ironwork was two - thirds of an inch thick all round . It was massive , well made , and solid , like a chest constructed to carry things of great price , but not one shred or crumb of metal or jewellery lay within it . It was absolutely and completely empty . '[118-mrs. cecil forrester] The treasure is lost , ' said [Miss Morstan]116-miss morstan calmly . As [I]118-mrs. cecil forrester listened to the words and realized what they meant , a great shadow seemed to pass from [my]118-mrs. cecil forrester soul . [I]118-mrs. cecil forrester did not know how this Agra treasure had weighed [me]118-mrs. cecil forrester down , until now that it was finally removed . It was selfish , no doubt , disloyal , wrong , but [I]118-mrs. cecil forrester could realize nothing save that the golden barrier was gone from between [us]976-us . '[118-mrs. cecil forrester] Thank [God]143-god ! ' [I]118-mrs. cecil forrester ejaculated from [my]118-mrs. cecil forrester very heart . [She]977-she looked at [me]118-mrs. cecil forrester with a quick , questioning smile . '[118-mrs. cecil forrester] Why do [you]0-i say that ? ' [she]977-she asked . '[0-i] Because [you]977-she are within [my]0-i reach again , ' [I]977-she said , taking [her]977-she hand . [She]977-she did not withdraw it . '[977-she] Because [I]0-i love [you]977-she , [Mary]116-miss morstan , as truly as ever [a man]1293-a man loved [a woman]979-a woman . Because this treasure , these riches , sealed [my]0-i lips . Now that they are gone [I]0-i can tell [you]977-she how [I]0-i love [you]977-she . That is why [I]0-i said , " Thank [God]143-god . " ' '[0-i] Then [I]0-i say " Thank [God]143-god , " too , ' [she]977-she whispered , as [I]0-i drew [her]977-she to [my]0-i side . [Whoever]180-whoever had lost a treasure , [I]0-i knew that night that [I]0-i had gained one . [A very patient man]1904-a very patient man was [that inspector in the cab]1905-that inspector in the cab , for it was a weary time before [I]0-i rejoined [him]1905-that inspector in the cab . [His]1905-that inspector in the cab face clouded over when [I]0-i showed [him]1905-that inspector in the cab the empty box . '[0-i] There goes the reward ! ' said [he]1905-that inspector in the cab gloomily . '[0-i] Where there is no money there is no pay . This night 's work would have been worth a tenner each to [Sam Brown]181-sam brown and [me]0-i if the treasure had been there . ' '[181-sam brown] [Mr. Thaddeus Sholto]120-thaddeus sholto is [a rich man]980-a rich man , ' [I]980-a rich man said ; '[980-a rich man] [he]120-thaddeus sholto will see that [you]120-thaddeus sholto are rewarded , treasure or no . ' [The inspector]1906-the inspector shook [his]1906-the inspector head despondently , however . ' [His]1905-that inspector in the cab forecast proved to be correct , for [the detective]543-the detective looked blank enough when [I]112-jones got to [Baker Street]53-baker street and showed [him]1905-that inspector in the cab the empty box . [They]1908-they had only just arrived , [Holmes]108-holmes , [the prisoner]1909-the prisoner , and [he]1905-that inspector in the cab , for [they]1908-they had changed [their]1908-they plans so far as to report [themselves]1908-they at [a station]1910-a station upon the way . [[My]112-jones companion]202-my companion lounged in [his]1905-that inspector in the cab arm - chair with [his]1905-that inspector in the cab usual listless expression , while [Small]124-small sat stolidly opposite to [him]1905-that inspector in the cab with [his]124-small wooden leg cocked over [his]124-small sound one . '[112-jones] This is [your]981-you doing , [Small]124-small , ' said [Athelney Jones]112-jones angrily . '[981-you] Yes , [I]0-i have put it away where [you]981-you shall never lay hand upon it , ' [he]1905-that inspector in the cab cried exultantly . '[0-i] It is [my]0-i treasure , and if [I]0-i ca n't have the loot [I]0-i 'll take darned good care that [no one else]1643-no one else does . [I]0-i tell [you]981-you that [no living man]983-no living man has any right to it , unless it is [three men who are in [the Andaman convict - barracks]985-the andaman convict - barracks and [myself]0-i]984-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself . [I]0-i know now that [I]0-i can not have the use of it , and [I]0-i know that [they]984-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself can not . [I]0-i have acted all through for [them]984-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself as much as for [myself]0-i . It 's been the sign of four with [us]986-us always . Well , [I]0-i know that [they]984-three men who are in the andaman convict - barracks and myself would have had [me]0-i do just what [I]0-i have done , and throw the treasure into [the Thames]18-the thames rather than let it go to [kith]987-kith or [kin of [Sholto]120-thaddeus sholto or [Morstan]116-miss morstan]988-kin of sholto or morstan . [You]989-you 'll find the treasure where the key is , and where [little Tonga]176-tonga is . When [I]0-i saw that [your]989-you launch must catch [us]986-us , [I]0-i put the loot away in a safe place . There are no rupees for [you]989-you this journey . ' '[989-you] [You]989-you are deceiving [us]986-us , [Small]124-small , ' said [Athelney Jones]112-jones sternly ; '[989-you] if [you]989-you had wished to throw the treasure into [the Thames]18-the thames , it would have been easier for [you]989-you to have thrown box and all . ' '[0-i] Easier for [me]0-i to throw , and easier for [you]989-you to recover , ' [he]0-i answered , with a shrewd , side - long look . '[0-i] [The man that was clever enough to hunt [me]0-i down]990-the man that was clever enough to hunt me down is clever enough to pick an iron box from [the bottom of [a river]992-a river]991-the bottom of a river . Now that they are scattered over five miles or so , it may be a harder job . It went to [my]0-i heart to do it , though . [I]0-i was half mad when [you]989-you came up with [us]986-us . However , there 's no good grieving over it . [I]0-i 've had ups in [my]0-i life , and [I]0-i 've had downs , but [I]0-i 've learned not to cry over spilled milk . ' '[0-i] This is a very serious matter , [Small]124-small , ' said [the detective]543-the detective . '[124-small] If [you]124-small had helped justice , instead of thwarting it in this way , [you]124-small would have had a better chance at [your]124-small trial . ' '[182-justice] [Justice]182-justice ! ' snarled [the ex - convict]1913-the ex - convict . '[993-a pretty justice] [A pretty justice]993-a pretty justice ! Whose loot is this , if it is not ours ? Where is the justice that [I]0-i should give it up to [those who have never earned it]994-those who have never earned it ? Look how [I]0-i have earned it ! Twenty long years in [that fever - ridden swamp]995-that fever - ridden swamp , all day at work under the mangrove - tree , all night chained up in [the filthy convict - huts]996-the filthy convict - huts , bitten by mosquitoes , racked with ague , bullied by [every cursed black - faced policeman who loved to take it out of [a white man]632-a white man]997-every cursed black - faced policeman who loved to take it out of a white man . That was how [I]0-i earned the Agra treasure , and [you]124-small talk to [me]0-i of justice because [I]0-i can not bear to feel that [I]0-i have paid this price only that [another]1282-another may enjoy it ! [I]0-i would rather swing a score of times , or have one of [Tonga]176-tonga 's darts in [my]0-i hide , than live in [[a convict]1551-a convict 's cell]1001-a convict 's cell and feel that [another man]1893-another man is at [his]1893-another man ease in [a palace with the money that should be [mine]0-i]1003-a palace with the money that should be mine . ' [Small]124-small had dropped [his]124-small mask of stoicism , and all this came out in a wild whirl of words , while [his]124-small eyes blazed and the handcuffs clanked together with the impassioned movement of [his]124-small hands . [I]1004-i could understand , as [I]1004-i saw the fury and the passion of [the man]1403-the man , that it was no groundless or unnatural terror which had possessed [Major Sholto]122-major sholto when [he]122-major sholto first learned that [the injured convict]1915-the injured convict was upon [his]122-major sholto track . '[1004-i] [You]1004-i forget that [we]1005-we know nothing of all this , ' said [Holmes]108-holmes quietly . '[1004-i] [We]1005-we have not heard [your]1004-i story , and [we]1005-we can not tell how far justice may originally have been on [your]1004-i side . ' '[1321-sir] Well , [sir]1321-sir , [you]1321-sir have been very fair - spoken to [me]0-i , though [I]0-i can see that [I]0-i have [you]1321-sir to thank that [I]0-i have these bracelets upon [my]0-i wrists . Still , [I]0-i bear no grudge for that . It is all fair and above - board . If [you]1321-sir want to hear [my]0-i story , [I]0-i have no wish to hold it back . What [I]0-i say to [you]1321-sir is [God]143-god 's truth , every word of it . Thank [you]1321-sir , [you]1321-sir can put the glass beside [me]0-i here , and [I]0-i 'll put [my]0-i lips to it if [I]0-i am dry . ' [I]0-i am [a Worcestershire man]1916-a worcestershire man [myself]0-i , born near [Pershore]84-pershore . [I]0-i dare say [you]1321-sir would find a heap of [Smalls]183-smalls living there now if [you]1321-sir were to look . [I]0-i have often thought of taking a look round there , but the truth is that [I]0-i was never much of a credit to [the family]1917-the family , and [I]0-i doubt if [they]1917-the family would be so very glad to see [me]0-i . [They]1917-the family were [all steady , chapel - going folk]1918-all steady , chapel - going folk , [small farmers]1919-small farmers , well known and respected over [the country - side]1920-the country - side , while [I]0-i was always [a bit of a rover]1921-a bit of a rover . At last , however , when [I]0-i was about eighteen , [I]0-i gave [them]1917-the family no more trouble , for [I]0-i got into a mess over [a girl]1922-a girl , and could only get out of it again by taking [the Queen]1544-the queen 's shilling and joining [the 3rd Buffs]1924-the 3rd buffs , which was just starting for [India]28-india . '[0-i] [I]0-i was n't destined to do much soldiering , however . [I]0-i had just got past the goose - step , and learned to handle [my]0-i musket , when [I]0-i was fool enough to go swimming in [the Ganges]85-the ganges . Luckily for [me]0-i , [[my]0-i company sergeant]1007-my company sergeant , [John Holders]184-john holders , was in the water at the same time , and [he]184-john holders was [one of [the finest swimmers in the service]1009-the finest swimmers in the service]1008-one of the finest swimmers in the service . [A crocodile]1010-a crocodile took [me]0-i , just as [I]0-i was half - way across , and nipped off [my]0-i right leg as clean as [a surgeon]1011-a surgeon could have done it , just above the knee . What with the shock and the loss of blood , [I]0-i fainted , and should have been drowned if [Holder]185-holder had not caught hold of [me]0-i and paddled for [the bank]1868-the bank . [I]0-i was five months in [hospital]1013-hospital over it , and when at last [I]0-i was able to limp out of it with this timber toe strapped to [my]0-i stump , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i invalided out of [the army]1014-the army and unfitted for any active occupation . ' [I]0-i was , as [you]1925-you can imagine , pretty down on [my]0-i luck at this time , for [I]0-i was [a useless cripple]1926-a useless cripple , though not yet in [my]0-i twentieth year . However , [my]0-i misfortune soon proved to be a blessing in disguise . [A man named [Abel White]186-abel white , who had come out there as [an indigo - planter]1928-an indigo - planter]1927-a man named abel white , who had come out there as an indigo - planter , wanted [an overseer]1929-an overseer to look after [his]1927-a man named abel white , who had come out there as an indigo - planter coolies and keep [them]1929-an overseer up to [their]1929-an overseer work . [He]1929-an overseer happened to be [a friend of [[our]1931-our colonel]1932-our colonel 's , who had taken an interest in [me]0-i since the accident]1930-a friend of our colonel 's , who had taken an interest in me since the accident . To make a long story short , [the colonel]1933-the colonel recommended [me]0-i strongly for the post , and , as the work was mostly to be done on horseback , [my]0-i leg was no great obstacle , for [I]0-i had enough knee left to keep a good grip on the saddle . What [I]0-i had to do was to ride over [the plantation]1934-the plantation , to keep an eye on [the men]1730-the men as [they]1730-the men worked , and to report [the idlers]1936-the idlers . The pay was fair , [I]0-i had [comfortable quarters]1937-comfortable quarters , and altogether [I]0-i was content to spend the remainder of [my]0-i life in indigo - planting . [Mr. Abel White]186-abel white was [a kind man]1938-a kind man , and [he]186-abel white would often drop into [[my]0-i little shanty]1939-my little shanty and smoke a pipe with [me]0-i , for [white folk out there]1940-white folk out there feel [their]1940-white folk out there hearts warm to each other as [they]1940-white folk out there never do here at [home]1329-home . '[0-i] Well , [I]0-i was never in luck 's way long . Suddenly , without a note of warning , the great mutiny broke upon [us]1015-our . One month [India]28-india lay as still and peaceful , to all appearance , as [Surrey]17-surrey or [Kent]86-kent ; the next there were [two hundred thousand black devils let loose]1016-two hundred thousand black devils let loose , and [the country]1386-the country was a perfect hell . Of course [you]1018-you know all about it , [gentlemen]344-gentlemen — a deal more than [I]0-i do , very like , since reading is not in [my]0-i line . [I]0-i only know what [I]0-i saw with [my]0-i own eyes . [[Our]1015-our plantation]1020-our plantation was at [a place called [Muttra]87-muttra , near [the border of [the North - west Provinces]88-the north - west provinces]1022-the border of the north - west provinces]1021-a place called muttra , near the border of the north - west provinces . Night after night the whole sky was alight with [the burning bungalows]1023-the burning bungalows , and day after day [we]1015-our had [small companies of [Europeans]187-europeans passing through [[our]1015-our estate]1025-our estate with [[their]1024-small companies of europeans passing through our estate with their wives and children , on their way to agra , where were the nearest troops wives]1026-their wives and [children]1027-children , on [their]1024-small companies of europeans passing through our estate with their wives and children , on their way to agra , where were the nearest troops way to [Agra]89-agra , where were [the nearest troops]1028-the nearest troops]1024-small companies of europeans passing through our estate with their wives and children , on their way to agra , where were the nearest troops . [Mr. Abel White]186-abel white was [an obstinate man]1029-an obstinate man . [He]186-abel white had it in [his]186-abel white head that the affair had been exaggerated , and that it would blow over as suddenly as it had sprung up . There [he]186-abel white sat on [[his]186-abel white veranda]1030-his veranda , drinking whisky - pegs and smoking cheroots , while [the country]1386-the country was in a blaze about [him]186-abel white . Of course [we]1015-our stuck by [him]186-abel white , [I]0-i and [Dawson]188-dawson , who , with [[his]188-dawson wife]1032-his wife , used to do the book - work and the managing . Well , one fine day the crash came . [I]0-i had been away on [a distant plantation]1033-a distant plantation , and was riding slowly [home]1329-home in the evening , when [my]0-i eye fell upon something all huddled together at [the bottom of [a steep nullah]1036-a steep nullah]1035-the bottom of a steep nullah . [I]0-i rode down to see what it was , and the cold struck through [my]0-i heart when [I]0-i found it was [[Dawson]188-dawson 's wife]1037-dawson 's wife , all cut into ribbons , and half eaten by jackals and native dogs . A little farther up [the road]1592-the road [Dawson]188-dawson [himself]188-dawson was lying on [his]188-dawson face , quite dead , with an empty revolver in [his]188-dawson hand , and four Sepoys lying across each other in front of [him]188-dawson . [I]0-i reined up [my]0-i horse , wondering which way [I]0-i should turn ; but at that moment [I]0-i saw thick smoke curling up from [[Abel White]186-abel white 's bungalow]1039-abel white 's bungalow , and the flames beginning to burst through the roof . [I]0-i knew then that [I]0-i could do [[my]0-i employer]1324-my employer no good , but would only throw [my]0-i own life away if [I]0-i meddled in the matter . From where [I]0-i stood [I]0-i could see [hundreds of [the black fiends]1042-the black fiends , with [their]1041-hundreds of the black fiends , with their red coats still on their backs , dancing and howling round the burning house red coats still on [their]1041-hundreds of the black fiends , with their red coats still on their backs , dancing and howling round the burning house backs , dancing and howling round [the burning house]1043-the burning house]1041-hundreds of the black fiends , with their red coats still on their backs , dancing and howling round the burning house . [Some of [them]1041-hundreds of the black fiends , with their red coats still on their backs , dancing and howling round the burning house]1044-some of them pointed at [me]0-i , and a couple of bullets sang past [my]0-i head : so [I]0-i broke away across [the paddy - fields]1045-the paddy - fields , and found [myself]0-i late at night safe within [the walls at [Agra]89-agra]1046-the walls at agra . ' As it proved , however , there was no great safety there , either . [The whole country]1942-the whole country was up like a swarm of bees . Wherever [the English]189-the english could collect in little bands [they]189-the english held just the ground that [their]189-the english guns commanded . Everywhere else [they]189-the english were [helpless fugitives]1943-helpless fugitives . It was a fight of [the millions]1944-the millions against [the hundreds]1945-the hundreds ; and the cruellest part of it was that [these men that [we]1947-our fought against , foot , horse , and [gunners]1948-gunners]1946-these men that we fought against , foot , horse , and gunners , were [[our]1947-our own picked troops , whom [we]1947-our had taught and trained , handling [our]1947-our own weapons and blowing [our]1947-our own bugle - calls]1949-our own picked troops , whom we had taught and trained , handling our own weapons and blowing our own bugle - calls . At [Agra]89-agra there were [the 3rd Bengal Fusiliers]1950-the 3rd bengal fusiliers , [some Sikhs]1951-some sikhs , [two troops of horse]1952-two troops of horse , and [a battery of artillery]1953-a battery of artillery . [A volunteer corps of [clerks]1955-clerks and [merchants]1956-merchants]1954-a volunteer corps of clerks and merchants had been formed , and this [I]1041-hundreds of the black fiends , with their red coats still on their backs , dancing and howling round the burning house joined , wooden leg and all . [We]1947-our went out to meet [the rebels]1957-the rebels at [Shahgunge]90-shahgunge early in July , and [we]1947-our beat [them]1957-the rebels back for a time , but [our]1947-our powder gave out , and [we]1947-our had to fall back upon [the city]1958-the city . '[1041-hundreds of the black fiends , with their red coats still on their backs , dancing and howling round the burning house] Nothing but the worst news came to [us]1047-us from every side — which is not to be wondered at , for if [you]1048-i look at the map [you]1048-i will see that [we]1047-us were right in the heart of it . [Lucknow]91-lucknow is rather better than a hundred miles to the east , and Cawnpore about as far to the south . From every point on the compass there was nothing but torture and murder and outrage . ' [The city of]1959-the city of [Agra]89-agra is [a great place]1960-a great place , swarming with [fanatics]1961-fanatics and [fierce devil - worshippers of all sorts]1962-fierce devil - worshippers of all sorts . [[Our]1947-our handful of [men]1412-men]1963-our handful of men were lost among [the narrow , winding streets]1965-the narrow , winding streets . [[Our]1947-our leader]1966-our leader moved across [the river]338-the river , therefore , and took up [his]1966-our leader position in [the old fort of [Agra]89-agra]1968-the old fort of agra . [I]1048-i do n't know if [any of [you]1048-i gentlemen]1969-any of you gentlemen have ever read or heard anything of [that old fort]1970-that old fort . It is [a very queer place the queerest that ever [I]1048-i was in]1971-a very queer place the queerest that ever i was in , and [I]1048-i have been in [some rum corners]1972-some rum corners , too . First of all [it]1970-that old fort is enormous in size . [I]1048-i should think that the enclosure must be acres and acres . There is a modern part , which took all [[our]1947-our garrison]1973-our garrison , [women]549-women , [children]1027-children , [stores]1976-stores , and everything else , with plenty of room over . But the modern part is nothing like the size of [the old quarter]1977-the old quarter , where [nobody]1978-nobody goes , and which is given over to [the scorpions and the centipedes]1979-the scorpions and the centipedes . It is all full of [great deserted halls]1980-great deserted halls , and [winding passages]1981-winding passages , and long corridors twisting in and out , so that it is easy enough for [folk]1455-folk to get lost in [it]1970-that old fort . For this reason it was seldom that [anyone]1983-anyone went into [it]1970-that old fort , though now and again [a party with torches]1984-a party with torches might go exploring . '[1048-i] [The river]338-the river washes along the front of [the old fort]1050-the old fort , and so protects [it]1050-the old fort , but on the sides and behind there are many doors , and these had to be guarded , of course , in [the old quarter]1977-the old quarter as well as in that which was actually held by [[our]1052-we troops]1053-our troops . [We]1052-we were short - handed , with [hardly men enough to man the angles of [the building]430-the building]1054-hardly men enough to man the angles of the building and to serve the guns . It was impossible for [us]1052-we , therefore , to station [a strong guard]1056-a strong guard at every one of the innumerable gates . What [we]1052-we did was to organize [a central guard - house in [the middle of [the fort]1059-the fort]1058-the middle of the fort]1057-a central guard - house in the middle of the fort , and to leave each gate under the charge of [one white man]1060-one white man and [two or three natives]1061-two or three natives . [I]0-i was selected to take charge during certain hours of the night of a small isolated door upon [the south - west side of [the building]430-the building]1062-the south - west side of the building . [Two Sikh troopers]1064-two sikh troopers were placed under [my]0-i command , and [I]0-i was instructed if anything went wrong to fire [my]0-i musket , when [I]0-i might rely upon help coming at once from [the central guard]1065-the central guard . As [the guard]1066-the guard was a good two hundred paces away , however , and as [the space between]1067-the space between was cut up into [a labyrinth of passages and corridors]1068-a labyrinth of passages and corridors , [I]0-i had great doubts as to whether [they]1064-two sikh troopers could arrive in time to be of any use in case of an actual attack . ' Well , [I]0-i was pretty proud at having this small command given [me]0-i , since [I]0-i was [a raw recruit]1985-a raw recruit , and [a game - legged one at that]1986-a game - legged one at that . For two nights [I]0-i kept the watch with [[my]0-i Punjaubees]1987-my punjaubees . [They]1987-my punjaubees were [tall , fierce - looking chaps]1988-tall , fierce - looking chaps , [Mahomet Singh]125-mahomet singh and [Abdullah Khan]126-abdullah khan by name , [both old fighting men , who had borne arms against [us]1990-us at [Chilian Wallah]92-chilian wallah]1989-both old fighting men , who had borne arms against us at chilian wallah . [They]1987-my punjaubees could talk English pretty well , but [I]0-i could get little out of [them]1987-my punjaubees . [They]1987-my punjaubees preferred to stand together and jabber all night in [their]1987-my punjaubees queer Sikh lingo . For [myself]0-i , [I]0-i used to stand outside the gateway , looking down on [the broad , winding river]1991-the broad , winding river and on the twinkling lights of [the great city]1352-the great city . The beating of drums , the rattle of tomtoms , and the yells and howls of [the rebels , drunk with opium and with bang]1993-the rebels , drunk with opium and with bang , were enough to remind [us]1990-us all night of [[our]1990-us dangerous neighbours]1994-our dangerous neighbours across [the stream]731-the stream . Every two hours [the officer of the night]1996-the officer of the night used to come round to all the posts , to make sure that all was well . '[0-i] The third night of [my]0-i watch was dark and dirty , with a small driving rain . It was dreary work standing in [the gateway]1069-the gateway hour after hour in such weather . [I]0-i tried again and again to make [[my]0-i Sikhs]1070-my sikhs talk , but without much success . At two in the morning the rounds passed , and broke for a moment the weariness of the night . Finding that [[my]0-i companions]1071-my companions would not be led into conversation , [I]0-i took out [my]0-i pipe , and laid down [my]0-i musket to strike the match . In an instant [the two Sikhs]1072-the two sikhs were upon [me]0-i . [One of [them]1072-the two sikhs]381-one of them snatched [my]0-i firelock up and levelled it at [my]0-i head , while [the other]954-the other held a great knife to [my]0-i throat and swore between [his]954-the other teeth that [he]954-the other would plunge it into [me]0-i if [I]0-i moved a step . ' [My]954-the other first thought was that [these fellows]613-these fellows were in league with [the rebels]1957-the rebels , and that this was the beginning of an assault . If [our]1999-our door were in the hands of [the Sepoys]2000-the sepoys [the place]592-the place must fall , and [the women]2002-the women and [children]1027-children be treated as [they]1072-the two sikhs were in [Cawnpore]93-cawnpore . Maybe [you]2004-you gentlemen think that [I]954-the other am just making out a case for [myself]954-the other , but [I]954-the other give [you]2004-you [my]954-the other word that when [I]954-the other thought of that , though [I]954-the other felt the point of the knife at [my]954-the other throat , [I]954-the other opened [my]954-the other mouth with the intention of giving a scream , if it was [my]954-the other last one , which might alarm [the main guard]2005-the main guard . [The man who held [me]954-the other]2006-the man who held me seemed to know [my]954-the other thoughts ; for , even as [I]954-the other braced [myself]954-the other to it , [he]2006-the man who held me whispered : " Do n't make a noise . [The fort]1059-the fort is safe enough . There are no rebel dogs on [this side of [the river]338-the river]2008-this side of the river . " There was the ring of truth in what [he]2006-the man who held me said , and [I]954-the other knew that if [I]954-the other raised [my]954-the other voice [I]954-the other was [a dead man]2010-a dead man . [I]954-the other could read it in [the fellow]603-the fellow 's brown eyes . [I]954-the other waited , therefore , in silence , to see what it was that [they]603-the fellow wanted from [me]954-the other . '[954-the other] " Listen to [me]0-i , [Sahib]139-sahib , " said [the taller and fiercer of [the pair]1076-the pair]1075-the taller and fiercer of the pair , [the one whom [they]1076-the pair called [Abdullah Khan]126-abdullah khan]1077-the one whom they called abdullah khan . " [You]139-sahib must either be with [us]1076-the pair now , or [you]139-sahib must be silenced for ever . The thing is too great a one for [us]1076-the pair to hesitate . Either [you]139-sahib are heart and soul with [us]1076-the pair on [your]139-sahib oath on the cross of [the Christians]1078-the christians , or [your]139-sahib body this night shall be thrown into [the ditch]1079-the ditch , and [we]1076-the pair shall pass over to [[our]1076-the pair brothers]1080-our brothers in [the rebel army]1081-the rebel army . There is no middle way . Which is it to be — death or life ? [We]1076-the pair can only give [you]139-sahib three minutes to decide , for the time is passing , and all must be done before the rounds come again . " ' " How can [I]1083-i decide ? " said [I.]1083-i " [You]139-sahib have not told [me]1083-i what [you]139-sahib want of [me]1083-i . But [I]1083-i tell [you]139-sahib now that if it is anything against the safety of [the fort]1059-the fort [I]1083-i will have no truck with [it]1059-the fort , so [you]139-sahib can drive home [your]139-sahib knife and welcome . " '[1083-i] " It is nothing against [the fort]1059-the fort , " said [he]1083-i . " [We]1076-the pair only ask [you]139-sahib to do that which [[your]139-sahib countrymen]1084-your countrymen come to [this land]1085-this land for . [We]1076-the pair ask [you]139-sahib to be rich . If [you]139-sahib will be one of [us]1076-the pair this night , [we]1076-the pair will swear to [you]139-sahib upon the naked knife , and by the threefold oath which [no Sikh]1086-no sikh was ever known to break , that [you]139-sahib shall have [your]139-sahib fair share of the loot . A quarter of the treasure shall be [yours]139-sahib . [We]1076-the pair can say no fairer . " ' " But what is the treasure , then ? " [I]1087-i asked . " [I]1087-i am as ready to be rich as [you]139-sahib can be , if [you]139-sahib will but show [me]1087-i how it can be done . " '[1087-i] " [You]139-sahib will swear , then , " said [he]1087-i , " by the bones of [[your]139-sahib father]1297-your father , by the honour of [[your]139-sahib mother]1089-your mother , by the cross of [your]139-sahib faith , to raise no hand and speak no word against [us]1076-the pair , either now or afterwards ? " ' " [I]1090-my comrade will swear it , " [I]1090-my comrade answered , " provided that [the fort]1059-the fort is not endangered . " '[1090-my comrade] " Then [[my]0-i comrade]1090-my comrade and [I]0-i will swear that [you]139-sahib shall have a quarter of the treasure which shall be equally divided among [the four of [us]1076-the pair]1091-the four of us . " ' " There are but three , " said [I.]1090-my comrade '[139-sahib] " No ; [Dost Akbar]127-dost akbar must have this share . But [the Sikh]1096-the sikh knows [the Englishman]1097-the englishman , and [the Englishman]1097-the englishman knows [the Sikh]190-the sikh . Hearken , then , to what [I]0-i have to say . ' " There is [a rajah in [the northern provinces]2015-the northern provinces who has much wealth , though [[his]2014-a rajah in the northern provinces who has much wealth , though his lands are small . much has come to him from his father lands]2016-his lands are small . '[0-i] " [This pretended merchant , who travels under the name of Achmet]1099-this pretended merchant , who travels under the name of achmet , is now in [the city of]1959-the city of [Agra]89-agra , and desires to gain [his]1099-this pretended merchant , who travels under the name of achmet way into [the fort]1059-the fort . What say [you]0-i to it , [Sahib]139-sahib ? " ' In Worcestershire the life of [a man]1293-a man seems a great and a sacred thing ; but it is very different when there is fire and blood all round [you]2033-you , and [you]2033-you have been used to meeting death at every turn . Whether [Achmet]177-achmet [the merchant]2034-the merchant lived or died was a thing as light as air to [me]1112-i , but at the talk about the treasure [my]1112-i heart turned to it , and [I]1112-i thought of what [I]1112-i might do in [the old country]2035-the old country with it , and how [[my]1112-i folk]2036-my folk would stare when [they]2036-my folk saw [their]2036-my folk ne'er - do weel coming back with [his]1113-this man pockets full of gold moidores . [I]1112-i had , therefore , already made up [my]1112-i mind . [Abdullah Khan]126-abdullah khan , however , thinking that [I]1112-i hesitated , pressed the matter more closely . '[1112-i] " Consider , [Sahib]139-sahib , " said [he]1112-i , " that if [this man]1113-this man is taken by [the commandant]1114-the commandant [he]1113-this man will be hung or shot , and [his]1113-this man jewels taken by [the Government]1115-the government , so that [no man]1116-no man will be a rupee the better for [them]1117-them . Now , since [we]1118-we do the taking of [him]1113-this man , why should [we]1118-we not do the rest as well ? The jewels will be as well with [us]1118-we as in [[the Company]2018-the company 's coffers]1120-the company 's coffers . There will be enough to make everyone of [us]1118-we [rich men]1121-rich men and [great chiefs]1122-great chiefs . [No one]229-no one can know about the matter , for here [we]1118-we are cut off from [all men]1124-all men . What could be better for the purpose ? Say again , then , [Sahib]139-sahib , whether [you]139-sahib are with [us]1118-we , or if [we]1118-we must look upon [you]139-sahib as [an enemy]1125-an enemy . " ' " [I]1113-this man am with [you]1113-this man heart and soul , " said [I.]0-i '[1113-this man] " It is will , " [he]1113-this man answered , handing [me]0-i back [my]0-i firelock . " [You]0-i see that [we]1118-we trust [you]0-i , for [your]0-i word , like [ours]1118-we , is not to be broken . [We]1118-we have now only to wait for [[my]0-i brother]387-my brother and [the merchant]2034-the merchant . " ' " Does [[you]1113-this man brother]2037-you brother know , then , of what [you]1113-this man will do ? " [I]1113-this man asked . '[1113-this man] " The plan is [his]1113-this man . [He]1113-this man has devised it . [We]1118-we will go to the gate and share the watch with [Mahomet Singh]125-mahomet singh . " ' The rain was still falling steadily , for it was just the beginning of the wet season . Brown , heavy clouds were drifting across the sky , and it was hard to see more than a stonecast . [A deep moat]2038-a deep moat lay in front of [our]1118-we door , but the water was in places nearly dried up , and it could easily be crossed . It was strange to [me]1113-this man to be standing there with [those two wild Punjaubees]2039-those two wild punjaubees waiting for [the man who was coming to [his]1113-this man death]2040-the man who was coming to his death . '[1113-this man] Suddenly [my]0-i eye caught the glint of a shaded lantern at the other side of [the moat]1128-the moat . It vanished among the mound - heaps , and then appeared again coming slowly in [our]1118-we direction . ' " Here [they]2039-those two wild punjaubees are ! " [I]126-abdullah khan exclaimed . '[126-abdullah khan] " [You]0-i will challenge [him]1113-this man , [Sahib]139-sahib , as usual , " whispered [Abdullah]126-abdullah khan . " Give [him]1113-this man no cause for fear . Send [us]1118-we in with [him]1113-this man , and [we]1118-we shall do the rest while [you]139-sahib stay here on guard . Have the lantern ready to uncover , that [we]1118-we may be sure that it is indeed [the man]1403-the man . " ' The light had flickered onwards , now stopping and now advancing , until [I]0-i could see [two dark figures upon the other side of [the moat]1128-the moat]2041-two dark figures upon the other side of the moat . [I]0-i let [them]2041-two dark figures upon the other side of the moat scramble down [the sloping bank]2043-the sloping bank , splash through [the mire]2044-the mire , and climb half - way up to the gate , before [I]0-i challenged [them]2041-two dark figures upon the other side of the moat . '[0-i] " Who goes [there]248-there ? " said [I]0-i , in a subdued voice . ' " [Friends]417-friends , " came the answer . [I]0-i uncovered [my]0-i lantern and threw a flood of light upon [them]2041-two dark figures upon the other side of the moat . [The first]2046-the first was [an enormous Sikh]2047-an enormous sikh , with a black beard which swept nearly down to [his]2046-the first cummerbund . Outside of [a show]2048-a show [I]0-i have never seen so tall [a man]1293-a man . [The other]954-the other was [a little fat , round fellow , with a great yellow turban]2051-a little fat , round fellow , with a great yellow turban , and a bundle in [his]954-the other hand , done up in a shawl . [He]954-the other seemed to be all in a quiver with fear , for [his]954-the other hands twitched as if [he]954-the other had the ague , and [his]954-the other head kept turning to left and right with two bright little twinkling eyes , like a mouse when [he]954-the other ventures out from [his]954-the other hole . It gave [me]0-i the chills to think of killing [him]954-the other , but [I]0-i thought of the treasure , and [my]0-i heart set as hard as a flint within [me]0-i . When [he]954-the other saw [my]0-i white face [he]954-the other gave a little chirrup of joy , and came running up towards [me]0-i . '[0-i] " [Your]1131-your protection , [Sahib]139-sahib , " [he]1132-he panted , " [your]139-sahib protection for [the unhappy merchant Achmet]1133-the unhappy merchant achmet . [I]0-i have travelled across [Rajpootana]94-rajpootana that [I]0-i might seek [the shelter of [the fort at [Agra]89-agra]2026-the fort at agra]1134-the shelter of the fort at agra . [I]0-i have been robbed and beaten and abused because [I]0-i have been [the friend of [the Company]193-the company]1136-the friend of the company . It is a blessed night this when [I]0-i am once more in safety — [I]0-i and [my]0-i poor possessions . " ' " What have [you]1132-he in the bundle ? " [I]1132-he asked . '[1132-he] " An iron box , " [he]1132-he answered , " which contains one or two little family matters which are of no value to [others]1137-others , but which [I]0-i should be sorry to lose . Yet [I]0-i am not [a beggar]1138-a beggar ; and [I]0-i shall reward [you]1139-you , [young Sahib]139-sahib , and [[your]1139-you governor]1140-your governor also , if [he]1140-your governor will give [me]0-i the shelter [I]0-i ask . " ' [I]1142-i could not trust [myself]1142-i to speak longer with [the man]1403-the man . The more [I]1142-i looked at [his]1403-the man fat , frightened face , the harder did it seem that [we]2053-we should slay [him]1403-the man in cold blood . It was best to get it over . '[1142-i] " Take [him]1132-he to [the main guard]2005-the main guard , " said [I.]1142-i [The two Sikhs]1072-the two sikhs closed in upon [him]1132-he on each side , and [the giant]1144-the giant walked behind , while [they]1072-the two sikhs marched in through the dark gateway . Never was [a man so compassed round with death]1145-a man so compassed round with death . [I]0-i remained at the gateway with the lantern . ' [I]1146-i could hear the measured tramp of [their]1072-the two sikhs footsteps sounding through [the lonely corridors]2054-the lonely corridors . Suddenly it ceased , and [I]1146-i heard voices , and a scuffle , with the sound of blows . A moment later there came , to [my]1146-i horror , a rush of footsteps coming in [my]1146-i direction , with a loud breathing of [a running man]2055-a running man . [I]1146-i turned [my]1146-i lantern down [the long straight passage]2056-the long straight passage , and there was [the fat man]2057-the fat man , running like the wind , with a smear of blood across [his]2057-the fat man face , and close at [his]2057-the fat man heels , bounding like a tiger , [the great black - bearded Sikh , with a knife flashing in [his]2057-the fat man hand]2058-the great black - bearded sikh , with a knife flashing in his hand . [I]1146-i have never seen [a man]1293-a man run so fast as [that little merchant]2060-that little merchant . [He]2057-the fat man was gaining on [the Sikh]1096-the sikh , and [I]1146-i could see that if [he]2057-the fat man once passed [me]1146-i and got to the open air [he]2057-the fat man would save [himself]2057-the fat man yet . [My]1146-i heart softened to [him]2057-the fat man , but again the thought of [his]2057-the fat man treasure turned [me]1146-i hard and bitter . [I]1146-i cast [my]1146-i firelock between [his]2057-the fat man legs as [he]2057-the fat man raced past , and [he]2057-the fat man rolled twice over like a shot rabbit . Ere [he]2057-the fat man could stagger to [his]2057-the fat man feet [the Sikh]1096-the sikh was upon [him]2057-the fat man , and buried [his]1096-the sikh knife twice in [his]2057-the fat man side . [The man]1403-the man never uttered moan nor moved muscle , but lay where [he]1403-the man had fallen . [I]1146-i think [myself]1146-i that [he]1403-the man may have broken [his]1403-the man neck with the fall . [You]2064-you see , [gentlemen]344-gentlemen , that [I]1146-i am keeping [my]1146-i promise . [I]1146-i am telling [you]2064-you every word of the business just exactly as it happened , whether it is in [my]1146-i favour or not . '[1146-i] [He]1146-i stopped , and held out [his]1146-i manacled hands for the whisky - and - water which [Holmes]108-holmes had brewed for [him]1146-i . For [myself]0-i , [I]0-i confess that [I]0-i had now conceived the utmost horror of [the man]1403-the man , not only for this cold - blooded business in which [he]1403-the man had been concerned , but even more for the somewhat flippant and careless way in which [he]1403-the man narrated it . Whatever punishment was in store for [him]1403-the man , [I]0-i felt that [he]1403-the man might expect no sympathy from [me]0-i . [Sherlock Holmes]108-holmes and [Jones]112-jones sat with [their]1148-their hands upon [their]1148-their knees , deeply interested in the story , but with the same disgust written upon [their]1148-their faces . [He]108-holmes may have observed it , for there was a touch of defiance in [his]108-holmes voice and manner as [he]108-holmes proceeded . ' It was all very bad , no doubt , '[108-holmes] said [he]108-holmes . ' [I]108-holmes should like to know how [many fellows in [my]108-holmes shoes]2066-many fellows in my shoes would have refused a share of this loot when [they]2066-many fellows in my shoes knew that [they]2066-many fellows in my shoes would have [their]2066-many fellows in my shoes throats cut for [their]2066-many fellows in my shoes pains . Besides , it was [my]108-holmes life or [his]1403-the man when once [he]1403-the man was in [the fort]1059-the fort . If [he]1403-the man had got out , the whole business would come to light , and [I]108-holmes should have been court - martialled and shot as likely as not ; for [people]1807-people were not very lenient at a time like that . '[108-holmes] ' Go on with [your]108-holmes story , '[108-holmes] said [Holmes]108-holmes shortly . ' Well , [we]2069-we carried [him]1403-the man in , [Abdullah]126-abdullah khan , [Akbar]127-dost akbar , and [I.]108-holmes A fine weight [he]1403-the man was , too , for all that [he]1403-the man was so short . [Mahomet Singh]125-mahomet singh was left to guard the door . [We]2069-we took [him]1403-the man to [a place which [the Sikhs]2071-the sikhs had already prepared]2070-a place which the sikhs had already prepared . It was some distance off , where a winding passage leads to [a great empty hall]2072-a great empty hall , the brick walls of which were all crumbling to pieces . The earth floor had sunk in at one place , making a natural grave , so [we]2069-we left [Achmet]177-achmet [the merchant]2034-the merchant [there]248-there , having first covered [him]1149-he over with loose bricks . This done , [we]2069-we all went back to [the treasure]2075-the treasure . '[108-holmes] It lay where [he]1149-he had dropped it when [he]1149-he was first attacked . The box was the same which now lies open upon [your]1150-your table . A key was hung by a silken cord to that carved handle upon the top . [We]1151-we opened it , and the light of the lantern gleamed upon a collection of gems such as [I]0-i have read of and thought about when [I]0-i was [a little lad]1152-a little lad at [Pershore]84-pershore . It was blinding to look upon them . When [we]1151-we had feasted [our]1151-we eyes [we]1151-we took them all out and made a list of them . There were one hundred and forty - three diamonds of the first water , including one which has been called , [I]0-i believe , " the Great Mogul , " and is said to be the second largest stone in existence . Then there were ninety - seven very fine emeralds , and one hundred and seventy rubies , some of which , however , were small . There were forty carbuncles , two hundred and ten sapphires , sixty - one agates , and a great quantity of beryls , onyxes , cats'-eyes , turquoises , and other stones , the very names of which [I]0-i did not know at the time , though [I]0-i have become more familiar with them since . Besides this , there were nearly three hundred very fine pearls , twelve of which were set in a gold coronet . By the way , these last had been taken out of the chest , and were not there when [I]0-i recovered it . ' After [we]1151-we had counted [our]1151-we treasures [we]1151-we put them back into the chest and carried them to the gateway to show them to [Mahomet Singh]125-mahomet singh . Then [we]1151-we solemnly renewed [our]1151-we oath to stand by [each other]1408-each other and be true to [our]1151-we secret . [We]1151-we agreed to conceal [our]1151-we loot in a safe place until [the country]1386-the country should be at peace again , and then to divide it equally among [ourselves]1151-we . There was no use dividing it at present , for if gems of such value were found upon [us]1151-we it would cause suspicion , and there was no privacy in [the fort]1059-the fort nor any place where [we]1151-we could keep them . [We]1151-we carried the box , therefore , into [the same hall where [we]1151-we had buried the body , and there , under certain bricks in the best - preserved wall]2079-the same hall where we had buried the body , and there , under certain bricks in the best - preserved wall , [we]1151-we made a hollow and put [our]1151-we treasure . [We]1151-we made careful note of [the place]592-the place , and next day [I]0-i drew four plans , one for each of [us]1151-we , and put the sign of the four of [us]1151-we at the bottom , for [we]1151-we had sworn that [we]1151-we should each always act for all , so that [none]1686-none might take advantage . That is an oath that [I]0-i can put [my]0-i hand to [my]0-i heart and swear that [I]0-i have never broken . '[0-i] Well , there 's no use [my]0-i telling [you]1153-you gentlemen what came of the Indian mutiny . After [Wilson]194-wilson took [Delhi]95-delhi and [Sir Colin relieved Lucknow]195-sir colin relieved lucknow the back of the business was broken . [Fresh troops]1154-fresh troops came pouring in , and [Nana Sahib]139-sahib made [himself]139-sahib scarce over [the frontier]1155-the frontier . A flying column under [Colonel Greathed]196-colonel greathed came round to [Agra]89-agra and cleared [the Pandies]96-the pandies away from [it]89-agra . Peace seemed to be settling upon [the country]1386-the country , and [[we]1157-our four]1158-we four were beginning to hope that the time was at hand when [we]1157-our might safely go off with [our]1157-our shares of the plunder . In a moment , however , [our]1157-our hopes were shattered by [our]1157-our being arrested as [the murderers of [Achmet]177-achmet]1159-the murderers of achmet . ' It came about in this way . When [the rajah]1110-the rajah put [his]1110-the rajah jewels into the hands of [Achmet]177-achmet [he]1110-the rajah did it because [he]1110-the rajah knew that [he]177-achmet was [a trusty man]2083-a trusty man . [They]2084-they are [suspicious folk in [the East]97-the east]2085-suspicious folk in the east , however : so what does [this rajah]2086-this rajah do but take [a second even more trusty servant]2087-a second even more trusty servant and set [him]2087-a second even more trusty servant to play [the spy upon the first]2088-the spy upon the first ? [This second man]2089-this second man was ordered never to let [Achmet]177-achmet out of [his]2089-this second man sight , and [he]2089-this second man followed [him]2089-this second man like [his]2089-this second man shadow . [He]2089-this second man went after [him]2089-this second man that night , and saw [him]2089-this second man pass through the doorway . Of course [he]2089-this second man thought [he]2089-this second man had taken refuge in [the fort]1059-the fort , and applied for admission [there]248-there [himself]2089-this second man next day , but could find no trace of [Achmet]177-achmet . This seemed to [him]2089-this second man so strange that [he]2089-this second man spoke about it to [a sergeant of [guides]2093-guides , who brought it to the ears of [the commandant]1114-the commandant]2092-a sergeant of guides , who brought it to the ears of the commandant . A thorough search was quickly made , and the body was discovered . Thus at the very moment that [we]2095-we thought that all was safe [we]2095-we were all four seized and brought to trial on a charge of murder — [three of [us]2095-we because [we]2095-we had held the gate that night , and the fourth because [he]2096-three of us because we had held the gate that night , and the fourth because he was known to have been in the company of the murdered man was known to have been in the company of [the murdered man]2097-the murdered man]2096-three of us because we had held the gate that night , and the fourth because he was known to have been in the company of the murdered man . Not a word about the jewels came out at the trial , for [the rajah]1110-the rajah had been deposed and driven out of [India]28-india : so [no one]229-no one had any particular interest in [them]2100-them . The murder , however , was clearly made out , and it was certain that [we]1160-we must all have been concerned in it . [The three Sikhs]2101-the three sikhs got penal servitude for life , and [I]1159-the murderers of achmet was condemned to death , though [my]1159-the murderers of achmet sentence was aftewards commuted into the same as [the others]435-the others . '[1159-the murderers of achmet] It was rather a queer position that [we]1160-we found [ourselves]1160-we in then . There [we]1160-we were all four tied by the leg and with precious little chance of ever getting out again , while [we]1160-we each held a secret which might have put each of [us]1160-we in [a palace]1161-a palace if [we]1160-we could only have made use of it . It was enough to make [a man]1293-a man eat [his]1293-a man heart out to have to stand the kick and the cuff of [every petty jack - in - office]1163-every petty jack - in - office , to have rice to eat and water to drink , when that gorgeous fortune was ready for [him]1293-a man outside , just waiting to be picked up . It might have driven [me]0-i mad ; but [I]0-i was always [a pretty stubborn one]1164-a pretty stubborn one , so [I]0-i just held on and bided [my]0-i time . ' At last it seemed to [me]2113-the surgeon to have come . [I]2113-the surgeon was changed from [Agra]89-agra to [Madras]98-madras , and from there to [Blair Island]99-blair island in [the Andamans]158-the andamans . There are [very few white convicts]2103-very few white convicts at [this settlement]2104-this settlement , and , as [I]2113-the surgeon had behaved well from the first , [I]2113-the surgeon soon found [myself]2113-the surgeon [a sort of privileged person]2105-a sort of privileged person . There was digging and ditching and yam - planting , and a dozen other things to be done , so [we]2110-we were busy enough all day ; though in the evening [we]2110-we had a little time to [ourselves]2110-we . '[2113-the surgeon] [The surgeon]2113-the surgeon , [Dr. Somerton]197-dr. somerton , was [a fast , sporting young chap]1166-a fast , sporting young chap , and [the other young officers]1167-the other young officers would meet in [[his]2113-the surgeon rooms]1168-his rooms of an evening and play cards . [I]0-i am fond of a hand at cards [myself]0-i , and it was almost as good as having one to watch [the others]435-the others . ' Well , there was one thing which very soon struck [me]1177-he , and that was that [the soldiers]2116-the soldiers used always to lose and [the civilians]2117-the civilians to win . [Mind]199-mind , [Idon't]200-idon't say there was anything unfair , but so it was . [These prison - chaps]2118-these prison - chaps had done little else than play cards ever since [they]2118-these prison - chaps had been at [the Andamans]158-the andamans , and [they]2118-these prison - chaps knew [each other]1408-each other 's game to a point , while [the others]435-the others just played to pass the time and threw [their]435-the others cards down anyhow . Night after night [the soldiers]2116-the soldiers got up [poorer men]2122-poorer men , and the poorer [they]2116-the soldiers got the more keen [they]2116-the soldiers were to play . [Major Sholto]122-major sholto was the hardest hit . [He]122-major sholto used to pay in notes and gold at first , but soon it came to notes of hand and for big sums . [He]1177-he sometimes would win for a few deals , just to give [him]1177-he heart , and then the luck would set in against [him]1177-he worse than ever . All day [he]1177-he would wander about as black as thunder , and [he]1177-he took to drinking a deal more than was good for [him]1177-he . '[1177-he] One night [he]1177-he lost even more heavily than usual .
