" '[954-the other] " It 's a dirty business , " [the other]954-the other answered . " Yet , as [you]0-i say , the money will save [our]1200-we commissions handsomely . " ' " Well , [Small]124-small , " said [the Major]262-the major , " [we]1200-we must , [I]954-the other suppose , try and meet [you]124-small . [We]1200-we must first , of course , test the truth of [your]124-small story . Tell [me]954-the other where the box is hid , and [I]954-the other shall get leave of absence and go back to [India]28-india in [the monthly relief - boat]2134-the monthly relief - boat to inquire into the affair . " '[954-the other] " Not so fast , " said [I]0-i , growing colder as [he]0-i got hot . " [I]0-i must have the consent of [[my]0-i three comrades]1208-my three comrades . [I]0-i tell [you]0-i that it is four or none with [us]1200-we . " ' " Nonsense ! " [he]0-i broke in . " What have [three black fellows]2135-three black fellows to do with [our]1200-we agreement ? " '[0-i] " Black or blue , " said [I]0-i , " [they]1208-my three comrades are in with [me]0-i , and [we]1200-we all go together . " ' Well , the matter ended by a second meeting , at which [Mahomet Singh]125-mahomet singh , [Abdullah Khan]126-abdullah khan , and [Dost Akbar]127-dost akbar were all present . [We]1200-we talked the matter over again , and at last [we]1200-we came to an arrangement . [We]1200-we were to provide both [the officers]624-the officers with charts of [the part of [the Agra fort]2138-the agra fort]2137-the part of the agra fort , and mark the place in the wall where the treasure was hid . [Major Sholto]122-major sholto was to go to [India]28-india to test [our]1200-we story . If [he]122-major sholto found the box [he]122-major sholto was to leave it [there]248-there , to send out [a small yacht provisioned]2140-a small yacht provisioned for a voyage , which was to lie off [Rutland Island]61-rutland island , and to which [we]1200-we were to make [our]1200-we way , and finally to return to [his]122-major sholto duties . [Captain Morstan]119-captain morstan was then to apply for leave of absence , to meet [us]1200-we at [Agra]89-agra , and there [we]1200-we were to have a final division of the treasure , [he]122-major sholto taking [the Major]262-the major 's share as well as [his]122-major sholto own . All this [we]1200-we sealed by the most solemn oaths that the mind could think or the lips utter . [I]0-i sat up all night with paper and ink , and by the morning [I]0-i had the two charts all ready , signed with the sign of four — that is , of [Abdullah]126-abdullah khan , [Akbar]127-dost akbar , [Mahomet]125-mahomet singh , and [myself]0-i . '[0-i] Well , [gentlemen]344-gentlemen , [I]0-i weary [you]344-gentlemen with [my]0-i long story , and [I]0-i know that [[my]0-i friend]1776-my friend [Mr. Jones]112-jones is impatient to get [me]0-i safely stowed in chokey . [I]0-i 'll make it as short as [I]0-i can . [The villain [Sholto]122-major sholto]1211-the villain sholto went off to [India]28-india , but [he]122-major sholto never came back again . [Captain Morstan]119-captain morstan showed [me]0-i [his]1211-the villain sholto name among a list of passengers in one of [the mail - boats]1212-the mail - boats very shortly afterwards . [[His]1211-the villain sholto uncle]1213-his uncle had died , leaving [him]1211-the villain sholto a fortune , and [he]1211-the villain sholto had left [the army]1014-the army ; yet [he]1211-the villain sholto could stoop to treat [five men]1215-five men as [he]1211-the villain sholto had treated [us]1216-we . [Morstan]119-captain morstan went over to [Agra]89-agra shortly afterwards , and found , as [we]1216-we expected , that the treasure was indeed gone . [The scoundrel]1217-the scoundrel had stolen it all , without carrying out one of the conditions on which [we]1216-we had sold [him]1217-the scoundrel the secret . From that day [I]0-i lived only for vengeance . [I]0-i thought of it by day and [I]0-i nursed it by night . It became an overpowering , absorbing passion with [me]0-i . [I]0-i cared nothing for the law — nothing for the gallows . To escape , to track down [Sholto]122-major sholto , to have [my]0-i hand upon [his]122-major sholto throat — that was [my]0-i one thought . Even the [Agra]89-agra treasure had come to be a smaller thing in [my]0-i mind than the slaying of [Sholto]122-major sholto . ' Well , [I]176-tonga have set [my]176-tonga mind on many things in this life , and never one which [I]176-tonga did not carry out . But it was weary years before [my]176-tonga time came . [I]176-tonga have told [you]2142-you that [I]176-tonga had picked up something of medicine . One day when [Dr. Somerton]197-dr. somerton was down with a fever a little [Andaman Islander]201-andaman islander was picked up by [a convict - gang in [the woods]2144-the woods]2143-a convict - gang in the woods . [He]201-andaman islander was sick to death , and had gone to [a lonely place to die]2145-a lonely place to die . [I]176-tonga took [him]201-andaman islander in hand , though [he]201-andaman islander was as venomous as a young snake , and after a couple of months [I]176-tonga got [him]201-andaman islander all right and able to walk . [He]201-andaman islander took a kind of fancy to [me]176-tonga then , and would hardly go back to [[his]201-andaman islander woods]2146-his woods , but was always hanging about [[my]176-tonga hut]1178-my hut . [I]176-tonga learned a little of [his]201-andaman islander lingo from [him]201-andaman islander , and this made [him]201-andaman islander all the fonder of [me]176-tonga . '[176-tonga] [Tonga]176-tonga — for that was [his]176-tonga name — was [a fine boatman]1218-a fine boatman , and owned [a big , roomy canoe of [his]176-tonga own]1219-a big , roomy canoe of his own . When [I]0-i found that [he]176-tonga was devoted to [me]0-i and would do anything to serve [me]0-i , [I]0-i saw [my]0-i chance of escape . [I]0-i talked it over with [him]176-tonga . [He]176-tonga was to bring [[his]176-tonga boat]1866-his boat round on a certain night to [an old wharf which was never guarded]1221-an old wharf which was never guarded , and there [he]176-tonga was to pick [me]0-i up . [I]0-i gave [him]176-tonga directions to have several gourds of water and a lot of yams , cocoa - nuts , and sweet potatoes . ' [He]176-tonga was stanch and true , was [little Tonga]176-tonga . [No man]1116-no man ever had [a more faithful mate]2149-a more faithful mate . At the night named [he]176-tonga had [[his]176-tonga boat]1866-his boat at [the wharf]1625-the wharf . As it chanced , however , there was [one of [the convict guard]2153-the convict guard down there]2152-one of the convict guard down there — [a vile Pathan who had never missed a chance of insulting and injuring [me]0-i]2154-a vile pathan who had never missed a chance of insulting and injuring me . [I]0-i had always vowed vengeance , and now [I]0-i had [my]0-i chance . It was as if fate had placed [him]176-tonga in [my]0-i way that [I]0-i might pay [my]0-i debt before [I]0-i left [the island]2155-the island . [He]176-tonga stood on [the bank]1868-the bank with [his]176-tonga back to [me]0-i , and [his]176-tonga carbine on [his]176-tonga shoulder . [I]0-i looked about for a stone to beat out [his]176-tonga brains with , but none could [I]0-i see . '[0-i] Then a queer thought came into [my]0-i head , and showed [me]0-i where [I]0-i could lay [my]0-i hand on a weapon . [I]0-i sat down in the darkness and unstrapped [my]0-i wooden leg . With three long hops [I]0-i was on [him]1222-him . [He]1222-him put [his]1222-him carbine to [his]1222-him shoulder , but [I]0-i struck [him]1222-him full , and knocked the whole front of [his]1222-him skull in . [You]1223-you can see the split in the wood now where [I]0-i hit [him]1222-him . [We]1224-we both went down together , for [I]0-i could not keep [my]0-i balance ; but when [I]0-i got up [I]0-i found [him]1222-him still lying quiet enough . [I]0-i made for [the boat]1668-the boat , and in an hour [we]1224-we were well out at [sea]1226-sea . [Tonga]176-tonga had brought all [his]176-tonga earthly possessions with [him]176-tonga , [his]176-tonga arms and [[his]176-tonga gods]1227-his gods . Among other things , [he]176-tonga had a long bamboo spear , and some Andaman cocoa - nut matting , with which [I]0-i made a sort of a sail . For ten days [we]1224-we were beating about , trusting to luck , and on the eleventh [we]1224-we were picked up by [a trader which was going from [Singapore]105-singapore to [Jiddah]106-jiddah with a cargo of [Malay pilgrims]1229-malay pilgrims]1228-a trader which was going from singapore to jiddah with a cargo of malay pilgrims . [They]1230-i were [a rum crowd]1231-a rum crowd , and [Tonga]176-tonga and [I]0-i soon managed to settle down among [them]1230-i . [They]1230-i had one very good quality : [they]1230-i let [you]1232-you alone and asked no questions . ' Well , if [I]1230-i were to tell [you]1232-you all the adventures that [[my]1230-i little chum]2157-my little chum and [I]1230-i went through , [you]1232-you would not thank [me]1230-i , for [I]1230-i would have [you]1232-you here until the sun was shining . Here and there [we]2158-we drifted about [the world]205-the world , something always turning up to keep [us]2158-we from [London]8-london . All the time , however , [I]1230-i never lost sight of [my]1230-i purpose . [I]1230-i would dream of [Sholto]122-major sholto at night . A hundred times [I]1230-i have killed [him]122-major sholto in [my]1230-i sleep . At last , however , some three or four years ago , [we]2158-we found [ourselves]2158-we in [England]6-england . [I]1230-i had no great difficulty in finding where [Sholto]122-major sholto lived , and [I]1230-i set to work to discover whether [he]122-major sholto had realized the treasure , or if [he]122-major sholto still had it . [I]1230-i made [friends]417-friends with someone who could help [me]1230-i — [I]1230-i name no names , for [I]1230-i do n't want to get [anyone else]2161-anyone else in a hole — and [I]1230-i soon found that [he]122-major sholto still had the jewels . Then [I]1230-i tried to get at [him]122-major sholto in many ways ; but [he]122-major sholto was pretty sly , and had always [two prize - fighters]377-two prize - fighters , besides [[his]122-major sholto sons]2163-his sons and [[his]122-major sholto khitmutgar]2164-his khitmutgar , on guard over [him]122-major sholto . '[1230-i] One day , however , [I]0-i got word that [he]1233-he was dying . [I]0-i hurried at once to [the garden]402-the garden , mad that [he]1233-he should slip out of [my]0-i clutches like that , and , looking through the window , [I]0-i saw [him]1233-he lying in [his]1233-he bed , with [[his]1233-he sons]2163-his sons on each side of [him]1233-he . [I]0-i 'd have come through and taken [my]0-i chance with [the three of [them]1236-the three of them]1236-the three of them , only even as [I]0-i looked at [him]1233-he [his]1233-he jaw dropped , and [I]0-i knew that [he]1233-he was gone . [I]0-i got into [[his]1233-he room]390-his room that same night , though , and [I]0-i searched [his]1233-he papers to see if there was any record of where [he]1233-he had hidden [our]1238-we jewels . There was not a line , however , so [I]0-i came away , bitter and savage as [a man]1293-a man could be . Before [I]0-i left [I]0-i bethought [me]0-i that if [I]0-i ever met [[my]0-i Sikh friends]1240-my sikh friends again it would be a satisfaction to know that [I]0-i had left some mark of [our]1238-we hatred ; so [I]0-i scrawled down the sign of [the four of [us]1238-we]1091-the four of us , as it had been on the chart , and [I]0-i pinned it on [his]1233-he bosom . It was too much that [he]1233-he should be taken to [the grave]1242-the grave without some token from [the men whom [he]1233-he had robbed and befooled]1243-the men whom he had robbed and befooled . ' [We]1238-we earned a living at this time by [my]0-i exhibiting poor [Tonga]176-tonga at fairs and other such places as [the black cannibal]2165-the black cannibal . [He]1233-he would eat raw meat and dance [his]1233-he war - dance : so [we]1238-we always had a hatful of pennies after a day 's work . [I]0-i still heard all the news from [Pondicherry Lodge]27-pondicherry lodge , and for some years there was no news to hear , except that [they]27-pondicherry lodge were hunting for the treasure . At last , however , came what [we]1238-we had waited for so long . The treasure had been found . It was up at the top of [the house]1422-the house , in [[Mr. Bartholomew Sholto]145-bartholomew sholto 's chemical laboratory]2167-mr. bartholomew sholto 's chemical laboratory . [I]0-i came at once and had a look at [the place]592-the place , but [I]0-i could not see how , with [my]0-i wooden leg , [I]0-i was to make [my]0-i way up to [it]592-the place . [I]0-i learned , however , about a trap - door in the roof , and also about [Mr. Sholto]145-bartholomew sholto 's supper - hour . It seemed to [me]0-i that [I]0-i could manage the thing easily through [Tonga]176-tonga . [I]0-i brought [him]176-tonga out with [me]0-i with a long rope wound round [his]176-tonga waist . [He]176-tonga could climb like a cat , and [he]176-tonga soon made [his]176-tonga way through the roof , but , as ill luck would have it , [Bartholomew Sholto]145-bartholomew sholto was still in [the room]233-the room , to [his]145-bartholomew sholto cost . [Tonga]176-tonga thought [he]176-tonga had done something very clever in killing [him]176-tonga , for when [I]0-i came up by the rope [I]0-i found [him]176-tonga strutting about as proud as a peacock . Very much surprised was [he]176-tonga when [I]0-i made at [him]176-tonga with the rope 's end and cursed [him]176-tonga for [a little bloodthirsty imp]2170-a little bloodthirsty imp . [I]0-i took the treasure box and let it down , and then slid down [myself]0-i , having first left the sign of the four upon the table , to show that the jewels had come back at last to [those who had most right to them]2171-those who had most right to them . [Tonga]176-tonga then pulled up the rope , closed the window , and made off the way that [he]176-tonga had come . '[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know that [I]0-i have anything else to tell [you]1244-you . [I]0-i had heard [a waterman]1245-a waterman speak of the speed of [[Smith]164-mordecai smith 's launch]1246-smith 's launch , [the Aurora]50-the aurora , so [I]0-i thought [she]50-the aurora would be [a handy craft for [our]1248-our escape]1247-a handy craft for our escape . [He]164-mordecai smith knew , no doubt , that there was some screw loose , but [he]164-mordecai smith was not in [our]1248-our secrets . All this is the truth , and if [I]0-i tell it to [you]1250-you , [gentlemen]344-gentlemen , it is not to amuse [you]1250-you — for [you]1250-you have not done [me]0-i a very good turn — but it is because [I]0-i believe the best defence [I]0-i can make is just to hold back nothing , but let all [the world]205-the world know how badly [I]0-i have [myself]0-i been served by [Major Sholto]122-major sholto , and how innocent [I]0-i am of the death of [[his]122-major sholto son]1749-his son . ' '[1250-you] A very remarkable account , ' said [Sherlock Holmes]108-holmes . '[1250-you] A fitting wind - up to an extremely interesting case . There is nothing at all new to [me]0-i in the latter part of [your]1250-you narrative , except that [you]1250-you brought [your]1250-you own rope . That [I]0-i did not know . [I]0-i think [she]116-miss morstan is [one of [the most charming young ladies [I]0-i ever met]1270-the most charming young ladies i ever met]1269-one of the most charming young ladies i ever met , and might have been most useful in such work as [we]1271-we have been doing . But love is an emotional thing , and whatever is emotional is opposed to that true cold reason which [I]0-i place above all things . [I]0-i should never marry [myself]0-i , lest [I]0-i bias [my]0-i judgment . ' '[0-i] [I]0-i trust , ' said [I]0-i , laughing , '[0-i] that [my]0-i judgment may survive the ordeal . '[150-goethe] By the way , à propos of this Norwood business , [you]0-i see that [they]1276-they had , as [I]0-i surmised , [a confederate in [the house]1422-the house]1277-a confederate in the house , who could be none other than [Lal Rao]156-lal rao , [the butler]1279-the butler : so [Jones]112-jones actually has the undivided honour of having caught one fish in [his]112-jones great haul .
